meanings.definition: A simultaneous discharge of firearms or other weapons.
meanings.sent1: During the battle, the soldiers heard the salvoing of cannons in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The military demonstration ended with a grand salvoing of rifles.
meanings.sent3: The movie scene was so realistic that the audience felt the salvoing of the guns in their seats.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm echoed the salvoing of nature's artillery across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The celebration concluded with a magnificent salvoing of fireworks lighting up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To fire a salute or volley of shots.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers will be salvoing their rifles in honor of the fallen heroes.
meanings.sent2: The hunters were salvoing their guns to scare away the birds from the crops.
meanings.sent3: The kids were salvoing water balloons at each other during the summer party.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks display seemed to be salvoing colors into the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The orchestra conductor raised his baton, ready to start salvoing music into the concert hall.

meanings.definition: To give a sudden burst of energy or activity.
meanings.sent1: After the break, the team started salvoing their efforts to catch up in the game.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's motivational speech salvoed the students into action for the school project.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock's loud ring salvoed me out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The news of the surprise party salvoed excitement into her otherwise dull day.
meanings.sent5: The energetic music at the concert salvoed the crowd into a dancing frenzy.
